title: 10 songs that shaped Sir Elton John’s career
text:
Elton says: “John Peel played ‘Music from Big Pink’ on his show and I was a religious follower of Peel in those days. He played all the great new music. Bernie [Taupin] and I freaked out when we first heard it. We hadn’t heard anything like this before; Americana done in a very soulful, funky, laidback way. This music changed my life because of the way the songs were written; the lyrics, the musicianship. It was a huge influence on things like ‘Tumbleweed Connection’. They were amazing."

"When I first played Philadelphia, we had a little grand piano with two legs by the keyboard and none on the other end. The other end was held up by orange boxes. Before I went on, The Band came into the dressing room, and it was one of the most touching things. I had so much support when I started out. Neil Diamond introduced me at [West Hollywood venue] The Troubadour, The Band came to see me, George Harrison sent me a telegram. Those kinds of things, for a young artist, give you great ratification. I do my own radio show, I’ve done it for four years, and the great thing is it gets me in contact with new singers. I make a point of phoning them when I like [their music], having lunch with them if I can. New music energises me. I know all the old stuff, but new music… If you hear something great by Billie Eilish or when Lorde did ‘Royals’ when she was 16, it’s like: ‘How did you do that?’ It energises me. It makes me feel good. And then I play it to death on my radio show.”
description: Sir Elton John picks the Tracks Of My Years with Ken Bruce
